tweets.text:
Keeping our Welsh Harp clean is a responsibility we all share. We are so grateful to our volunteers who contribute every day to reduce the high level of waste generated by years of neglect. 
@EnvAgency @CanalRiverTrust we must all play our part #cleantheharp https://t.co/eYHE85T20g

In response to increased community concerns of odour at Walleys Quarry in Silverdale #NewcastleUnderLyme & surrounding area we have installed this air quality monitoring unit off Galingale View.

Read more ‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/o558iAVicn

#Staffordshire @BBCRadioStoke @Sotlive https://t.co/BeeaGpjD6a

urls.title: Aaron Bell MP
urls.description: ODOUR COMPLAINTS Thank you to all the residents who have either written directly to me today, or copied me in to their complaints to the EA. I am aware that the EA are currently processing an...

tweets.text:
ODOUR

Thank you to all residents who have been in touch today.

Something must have changed in the last week & we cannot wait for the monitoring to be completed before addressing it. I have asked @EnvAgencyMids to consider making a statement asap.

https://t.co/d02VS1igSI?

@EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @SimonTagg @AaronBell4NUL The whole house this morning stinks from landfill at Whalleys Quarry.. vile ü§¢..action NOW..we don't need 'monitoring' to tell us the town reeks and it's helping to drive people away..ask Garners, ask Sainsbury's.üò†

tweets.text: Although the River #Thames is in its banks, fields by the river (here Little Wittenham) are waterlogged, soggy, 'over the top of your bootlaces' wet because they stored floodwater for weeks this winter @Floodplainmead #naturalfloodmanagement @EnvAgencySE @NE_Thames @JoClarkUoR https://t.co/Tt81t72f3u

Mattresses. Sofas. Duvets. Industrial fridges. Bags and bags of plastic. From the River Crane. Decided to take action after authorities failed the environment. @FriendsRivCrane @GuyLambert @CVP_CraneValley @CanLager @HestonActionG @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @LlangattockPick https://t.co/loCt8HiweY

@UnderwaterMedia @sascampaigns @leanahosea @CleanIlkley Sewage dumping is happening on the Thames too - no rain for several days yet the river at Barnes stank of sewage. Exceptional circumstances for CSO discharge? I don‚Äôt think so @thameswater @EnvAgency

On Wednesday we hosted a webinar with Paul Sayers (Sayers & Partners) and @DrMSteel (@EnvAgency) about modelling flooding events in the UK.

Watch again on YouTube: https://t.co/PkYJ16rZbR https://t.co/UvamgZS9Na

tweets.text: Makes no sense that to 'protect' Coggeshall from flooding, @EnvAgency thinks a ¬£25m project (dam & quarry) on the Blackwater will help - look at the map - flooding from Robins Brook & surface water is a high proportion of the risk  @piersmeyler @BW_Times @SarahPhillips8 https://t.co/uNeNgbpqj9

@CertusCC @UnderwaterMedia @sascampaigns @CleanIlkley @thameswater @EnvAgency Plse start collecting evidence. Video & don‚Äôt remove from your phone - you need to keep the metadata to prove location & dates.
@Lophophanes @NTBirdClub The mudflats outside of the @EnvAgencyYNE offices on Skinnerburn Road look perfect.

Time lapse cso start to full discharge, despite claims no rain here for 72 hours,Must be one of those many malfunctions. Taken after a dive at this area underwater, can think of better places to kneel
#sewage #pollution #sewage #environment @sascampaigns @leanahosea @CleanIlkley https://t.co/HusRw02FfD
@sudswatcher @NTBirdClub Just wish they'd use the Tyne as well!

From Monday 1st of March the EA will start building their compound in Rowntree Park. This is on the Butcher Terrace football field. The closure of Terry Avenue (except access) is a few weeks later. See Clementhorpe Flood Defences for details. @EnvAgencyYNE @CityofYork

tweets.text:
Visit today with @ChurnetFarmers co-ordinators at a large, intensive dairy farm where -back in 2016- @ChurnetValley @StaffsWildlife & the farmer constructed reedbeds & ponds to manage surplus yard run off. 

Need loads more of this!

(funding: @EnvAgencyMids & @HeritageFundUK) https://t.co/lbely4R0jD

@fayedavies @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids No whitewashing should be endured and no more soothing words and empty promises. @RedIndustries2 has to do more than the bare minimum and play their role as a genuine part of the community. No more lip service. #StopTheStink @DaveJonesNuL @CllrTonyK @AFH7_fbu @CllrStubbsNUL https://t.co/iIGyYCCOC2
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/QOmgkXEuzs

Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa
@AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids I could smell it from my house in Clayton today. God knows how people put up with that stench close to the site.
@kevin9360 @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids It may be the hospital chimney. I live opposite it and it's awful.

@HeywoodUp @JohnRooRoch @HumanUnkind3 @BBCNWT @deeplishcc @EnvAgencyYNE @widdymark1 @RochdaleOnline @GranadaReports @RochdaleCouncil @lwrochdale Keep the pressure on. Get local residents to write to their councillors. In non covid times we held workshops to help and support people to do this. We have also supplied template letters for people to use. 
Let them know you are not going away.

urls.title: Thames Estuary 2100: 10-Year Review monitoring key findings
urls.description: We use some essential cookies to make this website work. We‚Äôd like to set additional cookies to understand how you use GOV.UK, remember your settings and improve government services. We also use cookies set by other sites to help us deliver content from their services. Where we have identified any third party copyright information you will need to obtain permission from the copyright holders concerned. This publication is available at https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/thames-estuary-2100-te2100/tha

tweets.text:
Today @EnvAgency launches its 10 yr monitoring report into #ClimateEmergency related changes to the #Thames Estuary. By incorporating findings to the @TE2100Plan we are adapting to a more #ClimateResilient future. #TogetherForOurPlanet #RaceToResilience
https://t.co/Y9mD2SZ2zl https://t.co/JhF760gcsB

@RobMungovan @HMWTBadger @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust Hopefully leaving them?

@SineadCMooney @thameswater Dave, I highlighted this to one of your drivers on the 13th and he assured me he would feed it back. To hear ‚Äúwe can look into this‚Äù 2 weeks later is simply not good enough. Whilst Laleham Road is a residential B road, it is incredibly busy and this is driving us all nuts!

All will be revealedüëÄ

New licences from 1 March. Buy yours at https://t.co/4sWgIR7BC4 #Fishing https://t.co/Zvq8M6Yyp4

@paulthoro9ood @Nick_Unsworth @CllrRob @JamesAbbott2013 pls note.    @envAgency pls explain how Coggeshall is to be protected from surface water runoff and Robins Brook flooding by your proposed scheme?

The @EnvAgency are about to consider application for waste reinjection at #Brockham. The oil co needs to reinject to increase reservoir pressure to restart #oil production from old wells. @JamesBevanEA says thinking needs to change faster than the climate. Can we see the proof? https://t.co/erVgrAMoXv

tweets.text:
We have been installing steel sheet piles to strengthen flood defences at Titanic Bridge in #Lincolnshire. This will help to reduce flood risk.

Sign up to our flood warnings: https://t.co/hquuoBs8hF #Flood https://t.co/AdxoaRkQyu

Thank you to those who called us about an oil pollution on the River Dove near #Ashbourne #Derbyshire

We're working to locate the source & to minimise the impact on the #environment

If you have any information about this or to report any environmental incidents call 0800 807060 https://t.co/QLj8iBZx3H

Just two days to go until we reveal the new #fishing rod licences on Monday 1 March üòÄüé£üêü

It's an exciting time in the angling calendar and a sign that spring is around the corner!

Buy yours at: https://t.co/BRukTTXeNy https://t.co/xfWMcZKVw0

tweets.text: Appropriately on #WorldWetlandsDay I'm drafting the first case study of estuarine #rewilding to appear on @RewildingB network pages - @WWTSteart. Astonishing carbon sequestration figs and biodiversity benefits emerging from this @EnvAgency flood risk management project. https://t.co/qX0Rd7eLez

Spot the difference üëÄ 

Poor land management (on the left) contributes to flooding - but #NaturalFloodManagement (on the right) helps #slowtheflow of water, significantly reducing the impact of flooding on homes and businesses.

https://t.co/1iR1AvZFlK https://t.co/9Qr2E32DU7

@MSc_aquaticUCL @UCLgeography Here is a great @IapetusDTP @NERCscience @EnvAgency ¬£¬£ #phd for your current students & recent graduates! Come & join a friendly, award-winning team working on applied coastal/urban ecology and geomorphology topics! 1) https://t.co/8l7NOIoSdQ

tweets.text: @ClarkEv27594302 @Picklechu @NUL_Labour @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_uk Criticise all you like.  I work, live, and my children are educated within a mile of the landfill.  Four generations of my family live a stones throw away from the site.  I live with this stink every day, and have consistently opposed through every avenue at my disposal.

We‚Äôre working in partnership with @NDevonBiosphere @EnvAgencySW, the Woodland Trust and @NE_DCIoS to plant 40,000 trees to help improve water quality in the River Umber and at Combe Martin. Find out more here: https://t.co/q8yGULfhvg https://t.co/diyhrSOzLr
